text: Chederick van Wyk (born 8 February 1995) is a South African sprinter. == Career == Coloured, he won the silver medal during 2019 IAAF World Relays, with the African record in the 4 × 200 metres relay. During the 2019 Universiade in Naples, he won two more silver medals, 100 m and 200 m, just behind Paulo André de Oliveira. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=7|2019 |World Relays |Yokohama, Japan |bgcolor=silver|2nd |4 × 200 m relay |1:20.42 |- |rowspan=3|Universiade |rowspan=3|Naples, Italy |bgcolor=silver|2nd |100 m |10.23 |- |bgcolor=silver|2nd |200 m |20.44 |- | – |4 × 100 m relay |DNF |- |rowspan=3|African Games |rowspan=3|Rabat, Morocco |6th |100 m |10.31 |- |18th (sf) |200 m |21.22 |- |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |4 × 100 m relay |38.80 |} == Personal bests == {| class="wikitable" style="border-collapse: collapse; font- size: 95%;" |+Records personnels ! scope=col colspan=2| Event ! scope=col| Time ! scope=col| Venue ! scope=col| Date |- |align="center" | 100 m |Outdoor |align="center" | 10.18 | Sasolburg | 28 April 2018 |- |align="center" | 200 m |Outdoor |align="center" | 20.44 | Naples | 11 July 2019 |- |align="center" | 4 x 200 m |Outdoor |align="center" | 1:20.42 (AR) | Yokohama | 12 May 2019 |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:1995 births Category:Living people Category:Universiade medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Universiade silver medalists for South Africa Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2019 African Games Category:South African male sprinters Category:Medalists at the 2019 Summer Universiade
title: Chederick van Wyk
